line.en: Today's flight is all ready to go.
The Morning Glory will appear tomorrow.
Thinking like that, everyone was able to get in\nthe mood to really focus on their work.
It was set up to be like the real flight. From\ntakeoff all the way to getting up to the clouds.

Air currents are heavily dependent on season,
time, and the patterns of the pressure in the
sky. This makes it difficult to fly the same
course the same way.
However, places with frequent vertical drafts\ntend to have them because of topological reasons.
Today's flight is trying to be as close as it\ncould be to the real thing. It's basically a\npreview.
'Think you'll be able to do it?'
'I've caught a thermal before, but it's pretty\ndifferent from riding a vertical draft.'
'If I can't figure out the flow, I'll get\nconfused. Like if there is an unexpected\ndowndraft.'
'But I'll be fine. I'm sure I'll get used to it.'
After coming back from our second flight, we were\ntaking a break while Ageha and crew were checking\nthe glider.
'Flying an unfamiliar course was particularly\nhard, since the wind is strong today.'
I had been directing the course from behind so\nthat Kotori could focus on controlling the\nglider.
'We were carried much further than I expected.'
'My inspection's finished, Ageha. Everything\nseems to be in order!'
'Same here.'
'Okay. Let's take a five minute break and then\nstart the next flight.'
'How far is the next flight going to go? Since we\nhave some time, should we just wait and see\nagain?'
'No, I'd like to fly while we've got the time to\nspare. I don't want to be trying to come back\nwhen the sun's already gone down.'
'Okay, that sounds good.'
'...Also, this next flight is going to include\nthe possibility of an outside landing.'
An 'outside landing' is basically landing\nsomewhere other than the runway.

If the glider runs out of power, that means we
can't return to the runway like normal. However,
it isn't exactly the same as an emergency
landing.
Rather, it's to land in a place that won't be a\nbother and that allows for recovery if necessary.
Of course, that's ignoring any the possibility of\ndamage to the aircraft.
Since we never flew very far, we always flew with\nthe assumption we'd be returning to the runway.
We're still essentially doing that today, but\nthere's no guarantee when the real flight\nhappens.
Luckily, there's a lot of open land on the\nKazegaura mountainside . It shouldn't be hard to\nfind a place to do an outside landing.
'The wind sure has gotten strong...'
Amane whispered as she looked at the clouds\nmoving briskly across the sky.
'Yeah, it's much stronger than we had\nanticipated. We almost had to do an outside\nlanding earlier.'
'Hey! I went and bought some drinks!'
Ma-bou came back with a convenience store bag in\nhand.
He'd been out on a trip since morning.
It's about the time he'd usually get bored, but\nhe's surprisingly been helping out with a lot of\nstuff.
'Thanks, Ma-bou.'
'I didn't go for you. You're just lucky I\nhappened to get you one.'
'Haha, sure. You being in love with Aoi and all.'
'Wh, What? Shut up! I love Akari, you know\nthat!!'
I took the cold sports drinks from Ma-bou and\nhanded one to Kotori.
There's no AC in the cockpit, so it's like being\nin a greenhouse. It's really easy to get\ndehydrated.
'Okay, about time to get going.'
'Release the moor!'
Since the wind was strong today, the glider was\nmoored to the ground.
After it was released, Kotori headed off to the\ncockpit.
'Oh yeah. Aoi, instead of emergency rations,\nhere's some cookies...'
As Ageha called out for me and went to take the\ncookies from her...
The wind suddenly changed directions.
'Uwa!'
'Whoa!'
The wind coming from the lake suddenly blew\nstronger than it had all day.
'Watch out!!'
Turning my head to look upon I heard Amane's\nshriek, I saw...
not only the glider being pushed by the sudden\nburst of wind, but also...
right in front of that giant wing, a completely\nhelpless Kotori.
'KOTORI!!!!'
The next thing we knew, Kotori was hit by the\nmain wing and sent flying out her wheelchair.
'Kotori!!'
By the time I had made it to her side, she had\nlost consciousness.
I paced back and forth in front of the dorm\ntelephone.
'You need to calm down...'
'Yeah...'
I paused mid-response.
Kotori was taken to the hospital in an ambulance.
Hibari went with her, and I had only heard a\nlittle from her.
While she had no visible injuries, Kotori was\ngoing to be given a thorough examination.
Luckily, the wing hit her wheelchair, so Kotori\nwas only knocked out of it.
Hibari was supposed to contact me and let me know\nthe results, but I still hadn't heard anything.
I stared at my silent phone...
I let out a frustrated sigh as the door bell\nrang.
Only a moment later, there was a sudden banging\non the door.
'Wh... What...?'
'Come in.'
Ageha backed up and opened the door.
Standing there was...
'*pant* *pant*'
'...Tobioka-sensei!?'
'Is... Is Kotori all right?!'
Tobioka yelled as soon as he saw me.
How did he know?
Why was he that frantic?
Hundreds of questions popped into my head.
'...She's still at the hospital.'
'What hospital?!'
I told him the directions I had heard from\nHibari.
'She had no obvious injuries. They are giving her\na thorough examination right now.'
'*pant* *pant* ... *pant* ... *pant*'
Looking closely, I could see he was sweating.
Besides breathing heavily, sweat was beading on\nhis forehead and messing up his thinning hair.
It seems like he heard about the accident and\ninstantly ran here.
No, not 'seems like'.
'Morino-sensei should be at the hospital.'
Morino-sensei is our homeroom teacher.
But Tobioka isn't. Why would he rush all the way\nout here?
'...What happened? I just heard something really\nloud.'
Amane had come running from the dining hall after\nhearing the noise.
Tobioka glared at Amane as soon as he saw her.
'Amane, you are the supervisor here. This is your\nfault.'
'Do you intend to let the same thing happen\nagain?!'
Amane stood still, seemingly paralyzed by fear\nfrom the vicious reprimanding that Tobioka\nbarked.
He then gave us all a rage filled stare.
'An accident happened at an unapproved out of\nschool club activity. There's nothing you can say\nto excuse this.'
'The Soaring Club is now suspended indefinitely.\nAnd I'll be confiscating that trouble making\nglider.'
'If there is any other offense... You will be\ntaken care of. Mark my words.'
He spoke as if he had some deep-seated grudge.\nWhen finished, he marched out of the dorm.
He was likely headed to the hospital Kotori had\nbeen taken to.
'...What was that about?'
'I have no idea.'
Tobioka was mad. I could understand and even have\npredicted that much.
He was more than angry, however. I could see that\nhe was genuinely worried about Kotori.

He wasn't her homeroom teacher, supervisor, or
even someone who had much contact with her. He
had no particular reason to feel that strong
about Kotori.
While that was probably normal for a teacher, it\nstill seemed way too strong.
'...It's my fault.'
Amane spoke quietly.
'Like I said, it's not like that.'
We had repeated this conversation a number of\ntimes after Kotori had been taken to the\nhospital.
'I know you feel responsibility as the\nsupervisor, but this is my fault!'
Akari had said 'You can't be recognized as a club\nunless you have a supervisor.' which is why we\nasked Amane.
That was just a front, though. We intended to\ntake all responsibility were something to\nactually happen.
But the truth is that when something did happen,\nAmane would be the one to take the fall.
'No. I'm the one who assumed the role of\nsupervisor. Of course Tobioka-sensei should be\nangry at me.'
'Amane...'
There was nothing that could be said to console\nher. All we could do now was pray Kotori was\nokay.
'I see... I see... Really? That's good.'
'Yes, I see. Thank you for going through the\ntrouble to call me.'
'Please tell her I said hi.'
I let out a sigh of relief and set down the\nphone.
'What did they say?'
'They said they didn't find anything wrong.\nShe'll be spending the night at the hospital just\nto be safe.'
'Thank goodness...'
'Whew...'
'That's good...'
'...Phew.'
That was Hibari on the phone.
She had called to explain Kotori's situation.
'It sounds like she's okay.'
Kanako came out from the hallway and gave us all\na look.
'Sorry that I kept you worrying.'
'Seriously. Hey, Hat.'
'Quack quack!'
While there was no way Hat knew what happened,\nhis quack made it apparent he knew Kotori's\nabsence meant something was wrong.
'I'll go let Yuka and everyone else know.'
Kanako left the dining hall, taking Hat with her.
'I guess I'll be going too.'
'Okay. I'll walk with you for a bit. What are you\ngoing to do, Amane? I'll prepare a room if you\nwant to stay here.'
'...No, I've got some work to do, so I'm going\nback. Let me know if something happens.'
'Got it.'
Knowing that Kotori was okay, we were finally\nable to move away from the phone.
I went outside with Ageha.
'The cicadas sure have gotten quiet.'
'That's 'cause summer's over.'
After a few days it'll be September, and summer\nvacation will be over.
So much had happened to us this month that it was\nover before any of us knew it.
Ageha stopped unexpectedly.
'? What's wrong?'
Ageha folded her hands around mine.
'Ageha...'
Her hands were trembling.
Not only her hands but her shoulders, her knees,\nher lips... It was as if the trembles had taken\nover her entire body.
'I felt relieved, but now I just feel so scared\nall of a sudden...'
'Sorry. Just for a little bit...'
'Okay.'
I answered briefly and began to hold her hands\nback in return.
'...When I saw Kotori on the ground... I was so\nscared..'
'I didn't know what to do if something like this\nhappened to her... I was terrified...'
As she whispered this, Ageha was shaking as if\nshe had chills.
It was as if her blood was frozen - the same\nfeeling I had when I saw what happened to Kotori.
It was a truly horrifying, chilling moment.
I held Ageha's hands tightly. I wasn't sure if it\nwas to comfort her or myself.
'Okay, I feel a bit better.'
Ageha let go of my hands.
'Thanks, Aoi...'
'Don't mention it. I feel a bit relieved myself.'
'I'll apologize to Kotori later. You know, for\nholding your hands.'
Ageha smiled and laughed. She was back to her\nnormal self.
We continued to walk.
'The sun is setting...'
Ageha whispered as she looked up the slightly\nhilly road we were walking on.
The setting sun gave the sky and clouds an orange\nglow.
'...Well, it looks like it won't be coming\ntomorrow.'
'Yeah.'
On the night before the Morning Glory's\nappearance, the eastern sky is purple.
Last year we saw a bluish purple sky.
The next morning, Amane was cursing at the sky.
Tonight's moon was orange as always. The Morning\nGlory won't be coming tomorrow.
'I hope it doesn't come while Kotori's not here.'
'I know. She's been waiting for this all of her\nlife.'
'...Oh yeah, what happened to the glider?'
'Look over there!'
We could see the shadows of about five people on\nthe runway.
They were dismantling our glider.
'It's some teachers...'
Amongst the faces I saw teachers from our school.
'Hey! What are you doing!?'
'Tsk... Get out of here Aoi!'
'Tobioka...!'
'I told you I was confiscating the glider. After\nall, you stole it from the school to begin with.'
They took off the main wing and dumped it into\nthe back of a truck.
'Stop! If you're not careful with the wing\nyou'll...!'
Ageha ran up to the teachers.
'Please! Use this trailer!'
A trailer made specifically for transporting the\nglider was nearby.
Ageha realized stopping them was not possible.\nInstead she focused on helping them use the\ntrailer.
She didn't want the glider to get damaged.
'Aoi, help me!'
'O, okay!'
'Hmph, seems like you've got the right idea.'
We showed the teachers how to dismantle it and\ngot it loaded onto the trailer.
'Once it's all ready to go, take it to the\nschool.'
Tobioka gave orders to the other teachers.
'What are you going to do to the glider?'
'That has nothing to do with you. I will tell\nyou, however, that if you steal it again you\nwon't be so lucky.'
'Okay, take it out of here now.'
The trailer and the car pulling it began to move.
After confirming it was okay, Tobioka went over\nto his own car.
At that moment, he turned his head to look at us.
When our eyes met, he looked at me as if nothing\nhad happened. He proceeded to get in his car and\ndrive off the runway.
All we could do was watch it leave.
The next day...
'Hey guys, I'm back!!'
A bit after noon, Hibari brought Kotori back.
'KOTORI!!!'
'Asa, stop.'
Asa lunged towards Kotori, but Yoru held her\nback.
'Uwauwauwa, let me go!!'
'She's still recovering, Asa.'
'Quack, quack!'
Hat flew over to Kotori and sat on her lap.
'Haha, hi Hat. How are you doing?'
Seeing her like this, I let out a sigh of relief.
Everyone had waited here for her to come back.
'Well, haha, I feel kinda bad. I mean, everyone\nis here to welcome me back.'
'Seriously, who do you think you are.'
'So is everything alright...?'
'Yep, I'm fine. I only bumped my head a little.'
'It was only a slight concussion.'
'I actually wanted to come back yesterday, but\nHibari was worried about me.'
'But look! I'm fine as fine can be!'
Kotori was waving her arms all around and being\nunusually talkative.
Her wheelchair was a bit banged up.
That must have been where the wing hit.
Just from seeing her wheelchair, I could tell how\nhard the impact was.
'I'm sorry, Kotori.'
'Huh? What are you apologizing for?'
'If I hadn't left your side, this would have\nnever...'
'No. That's not it at all. I moved away from\nyou.'
'That was my mistake. It's no one else's fault.'
'Nothing happened! There's nothing to worry\nabout!'
Hibari stood behind her cheerful sister with a\nsolemn expression on her face.
'Alright then. Let's get back to practice.'
'Huh?'
'Practice? But you...'
'Well we didn't do everything yesterday, right?\nWe still have to do a practice run for the real\nthing.'
'I felt so uneasy looking at the sky out of the\nhospital window. What would I do if the Morning\nGlory came while I was there?'
'C'mon, let's go. We're running out of time.'
'Don't be ridiculous!'
A scream suddenly ripped out of the pale Hibari.
'How can you say that after what happened\nyesterday?'
'Yesterday... Nothing really happened yesterday.'
'You just got lucky. If that happens again, who\nknows what could happen.'
'...Please, Hibari. Morning Glory is already on\nits way.'
'Maybe tonight, maybe tomorrow morning or the day\nafter. We're running out of time.'
'No. I'm not letting you do it.'
'Hibari...'
'Kotori, at least right now you should rest. I\nmean...'
'Aoi, not you too! You know I don't have time to\nrest.'
'I'm fine. The doctor already said so.'
I didn't know whether or not to tell her about\nthe glider being confiscated.
If I told her, she would be devastated. She would\nabsolutely feel that it was all her fault.
Without me saying anything, Hibari began to\nspeak.
'...It's finished, Kotori. Even if I said it was\nokay, there's no way you could do it.'
'What do you mean?'
The front doorbell rang.
We weren't expecting anyone right now. It was\nprobably a teacher or someone like that.
'I'll be right there.'
After opening the door a well-dressed man in a\nsuit walked in.
'Dad!?'
'...Kotori!!'
Seeing his daughter, he ran over and kneeled down\nnext to her wheelchair.
'I heard you hit your head. Are you all\nright...?'
'I...I'm fine. Nothing really happened.'
'But weren't you in the hospital yesterday?'
'It was just a regular examination. I just... I\njust slipped down a hill.'
'Kotori... He already knows.'
'I told him everything yesterday. The cause of\nthe accident... The stuff you kept from him.'
Saying nothing, Kotori's father looked at her\nwith tears in his eyes.
Kotori turned to look at Hibari.
'You promised! You said you were going to wait\nuntil the end of summer!'
'How could I not tell him?'
'But if you told him, that means...'
Kotori glanced over at her father.
He was looking at her with intense sadness. She\nturned her head away in shame.
'You knew how much we had been worrying about\nyou.'
'Yet despite that...'
'No, dad. That's not it. If I told you you would\nhave said no... Because...'
'Of course I would have! Did you forget what\nhappened that made you like this to begin with?'
Kotori shook her head.
'So then whey did you go and do something\nridiculously dangerous like riding a glider?'
Her father's voice was quiet yet reproachful.
Kotori hung her head low and said nothing in\nresponse.
'Please, dad... Just until summer vacation is\nover. Let me keep flying the glider.'
'No.'
'Dad!'
'I can't let you keep doing this dangerous\nhobby.'
'I've been working with everyone here. Because\nthis summer...'
'And this isn't just a 'hobby'! This is my\npassion!'
Kotori's father looked at his daughter with sad\neyes.
'You flew in the sky on a glider. That's just far\ntoo dangerous.'
'If you really want to fly, pick something safer.\nI'll even help you pick something.'
'That's not it at all...'
Kotori was searching for the right words to\ndefend herself, but she could not find them.
Why she wanted to fly, why it had to be a glider\n- she needed to be able to say why she had those\nfeelings.
Whatever words she would pick, however, just\nwould not convey her feelings to anyone else.
Looking at his daughter struggling for words, he\nlet out a heavy sigh.
'...I can't let you stay here anymore. Now come\non. You're coming home with me.'
'What... No, wait. Please listen.'
Kotori threw her head up to protest, but her\nfather began to wheel her out while completely\nignoring her.
'Please wait, Habane-san.'
I couldn't help but throw myself between Kotori\nand her father.
He looked at me with puzzled eyes.
When he called a few days before, Kotori's father\nhad completely trusted me.
I had betrayed that trust.
Like Kotori, I had not said things that should\nhave been said.
'We all worked towards getting Kotori to be able\nto fly.'
'You said it on the phone, didn't you? About how\nKotori changing was all due to me.'
'That's not right. It was all due to the\nglider... And all of her friends here.'
Kotori nodded desperately.
'This time there was an accident, but... But our\ngoal is right in front of our eyes!'
'If you say Kotori can't fly, then she can't.\nBut, please... Please, at least let her finish\nthis.'
I spoke as earnestly as I could. My head was\nbowed to him.
'We're all asking you to let her.'
'Please, Habane-san.'
'Please...'
Her father looked at the members of the Soaring\nClub, each with their head bowed.
'...You all should know about my daughter's\nhandicap very well.'
'She cannot do many of the things you all take\nfor granted.'
He spoke in a quiet yet grave tone.
'Please don't get her all wrapped up in your\nnormal person dreams...'
'Dad! Don't talk like that!'
'It's the truth.'
Kotori turned pale as she heard what her father\nwas saying.
'You... You know I've been practicing... right?\nI've... I've been working so hard to get good at\nthis...'
'I'm now able to fly the glider completely by\nmyself...'
'...That's just because everyone here helped you,\nisn't it?'
'That's... That's because the glider is\ncompletely safe...'
'I said I already flew...'
'Do you remember what you told us when you left\nhome?'
'You said it yourself. You don't want to make us\nworry about you. ...That's why you went to this\nschool all by yourself.'
'...I still feel the same way now.'
As she said that, her father ran his hand over\nthe damaged part of her wheelchair.
'You were lucky that only your chair got hit.\nWhat... What would have happened to you if it\nwasn't the chair...'
'Let's go home, Kotori. Your mother is worrying.\nYou need to show her everything is alright.'
He starts pushing her wheelchair.
If I didn't do anything, Kotori would be gone\nforever.
'Wai-'
'Dad, wait!!!'
Kotori stopped the wheels.
'Kotori!'
'Please, let me stay here! I'll forget about the\nglider! I won't fly anymore!!'
'Please... I... I just want to be here..'
Kotori's father looked at his crying daughter\nwith sadness in his own eyes.
'You have to understand our feelings.'
'*sob* ... *sob* ...I... I... I don't want to\ngo.'
'Kotori...'
'Hey, dad. Let's give her a little time.'
'I'll look after her tonight and talk to her when\nshe's calmed down.'
'How does that sound, Kotori?'
Kotori's father silently nodded.
'...I'll come back later. Until then, watch after\nher.'
'Kotori, call your mother. Let her hear that\nyou're okay.'
'...Okay, I will.'
Hibari made a slight bow to us and began to push\nKotori's wheelchair.
'Kotori!'
Kotori is going to leave...
As I started to run after them, Kotori's father\nturned to face me.
'This is my family's problem...'
He said this with an anguished look on his face\nand then proceeded to put his head down and\nleave.
After Kotori left, a sadness fell upon all in the\ndorm. We all gathered in the dining hall for no\nparticular purpose.
Not wanting to be alone, I stayed nearby in the\nkitchen and did some of my work.
'Kotori will come back... right?'
'Sure. She'll be wanting to come back.'
'Even though, her father wouldn't even listen to\nher... Terrible.'
'...I don't really think we have much say in any\nof this.'
Everyone turned to look at me after my whisper\ncarried over the counter.
'When Kotori was unconscious after the accident,\nwe all were so worried... no, scared.'
As I spoke, everyone's expressions went dark as\nthey remembered that moment.
'To hear that news all the way in Tokyo... Her\nfather must have been completely terrified.'
'...Yeah, that's true.'
'But the things he said where terrible.'
'Kotori... Kotori won't be able to realize her\ndream with us.'
Please don't get her all wrapped up in your\nnormal person dreams...
Even though it wasn't about me, hearing her\nfather say those words ripped my heart out.
I had always been by her side. To see all of her\nefforts, her dreams, not able to be realized was\ncrushing.
I can't imagine how Kotori felt when she heard\nthat...
The front doorbell rang.
'Hey Aoi! Hibari is here!'
Everyone looked up as Kanako called for me.
I dried off my hands and hurried to the entrance.
'I want to apologize for how my father acted\nearlier...'
'No, I should be the one apologizing. It's not my\nplace to say anything. How's Kotori?'
'She's at my house right now. She cried herself\nto sleep.'
'If she calms down, I plan on having her and my\nfather talk tonight.'
'I see...'
I was relieved to know she wouldn't be going back\nto Tokyo immediately.
'...Did my father upset you?'
'No, that's not really it...'
'I think he just got very emotional, hearing\nabout the accident and the glider all at once.'
'He was shocked... I was too.'
All the things that were hidden were revealed in\nthe worst way possible.
Considering that, he was quit calm, even\ngentlemanly.
'I'm sorry that I didn't say anything.'
'If we hadn't known about Kotori's accident,\nwell, that's that.'
'The problem is that she stayed quiet even though\nshe knew we were worrying about her.'
'What's going to happen with her?'
The look on Hibari's face told me that she didn't\nknow.
'That's for Kotori and my father to discuss.'
'If he's opposed to it, she'll never lay a finger\non a glider again.'
'Wouldn't she be able to stay if that were the\ncase?'
'...If you can promise that she won't go near the\nglider I may be able to convince him to let her\nstay.'
'Thanks.'
Hibari bowed and took her leave.
'What happened?'
'What did Hibari want?'
'What's going to happen to Kotori?'
As I entered the dining hall, an avalanche of\nquestions came my way.
I had to push my way into the dining hall.
'We don't know anything yet. Kotori is going to\ntalk to her father tonight.'
'Hibari seems to understand our position. She's\non Kotori's side.'
'That is... on the condition Kotori doesn't go\nnear the glider again.'
'That'd be good...'
Asa sat down looking relieved.
Ageha and Yoru didn't seem as relaxed.
'...All we can do now is wait.'
'Right. And we need to do what we can do.'
'So we can fly when Kotori comes back.'
After finishing my kitchen work, I headed back to\nmy room for a breather.
All the worrying and stress from the past two\ndays had made me exhausted.
I laid in my bed and closed my eyes.
'Kotori...'
Please, let me stay here! I'll forget about the\nglider! I won't fly anymore!!
Please... I... I just want to be here..
Remembering Kotori's tear stained face as she\npleaded with her father twisted my heart in two.
Honestly, as long as Kotori came back, not being\nable to fly over the Morning Glory isn't even a\nproblem.
I'm even fine with giving up on the glider.
If we promised that, perhaps Kotori's father\nwould allow her to be here...
Wanting to hear Kotori's voice, I pulled out my\ncell phone.
I selected Kotori's name in my contact list.
I stopped.
Kotori and her father may have already started\ntalking.
If I called now, I would just be a nuisance.
Just as I closed my phone and was about to put it\nback into my pocket,
it rang.
I instantly opened it again and checked the\nscreen.
'Ageha'
'Ageha's calling...?'
Didn't she just go home a little bit ago?
'Hello.'
'Aoi, you need to come quick.'
There was a sense of urgency in he voice.
'Calm down. Where should I go?'
'The runway. Quick.'
I ran with Asa and Yoru to the runway. Ageha was\nthere with An-chan.
An-chan had lifted the cover off of the winch and\nwas staring at it.
'Aoi!'
Ageha rushed over as soon as she saw me.
'Are... are you crying?'
Her eyes were red and filled with tears.
'What happened...?'
'...What's going on?'
An-chan pulled his head away from the winch.
'...This is serious.'
I was at a loss for words when I saw it myself.
'What... Why...'
'...What happened?'
All the machinery had been destroyed.
'Even if we tried to fix it, it's so smashed up\nthere's no way we could.'
He seemed completely confused and frustrated.
'What is this? Who in the world could have done\nthis...'
As soon as the words left my mouth, I had a\nrealization.
There is only one person who could have done\nthis.
'Tobioka-sensei was acting a bit strange\nyesterday when they were taking the glider. When\nI thought about that I came here and...'
'I found it like this...'
'...He did it.'
'I don't know. But...'
I clenched my fist so hard my nails began digging\ninto my palm.
'This is beyond terrible...'
'Unforgivable...'
'What do we do, Aoi? ...We'll never be able to\nfly like this.'
I could hear her beginning to cry as she\nwhispered. I put an arm around her shoulder to\nsteady her.
She was trembling so much that she had to use my\nbody for support.
'Why... Until yesterday we were so close... We\nwere so close...'
'Suddenly it's all gone...'
Not only did we lose the glider, our wings, but\nthe winch was broken too.
We lost all our means of getting up into the sky.
After taking Ageha back home, I brought Asa and\nYoru to the dorm.
Having seen all of them in tears brought an even\nheavier sadness over me.
Why did this happen to us?

Confused by the strange, yet obvious, malice, and
the sense of loss from having the glider taken
away, I was consumed by an overpowering sense of
lethargy.
'Are you okay?'
'Yeah... I'm fine.'
'Thanks for coming.'
An-chan had come as soon as Ageha called him.
When I came, Ageha had already looked like she\nwas about to cry.
If he hadn't come, she would have already burst\ninto tears by now.
'Well, I always do come when you guys need me.'
He spoke with an anxious look on his face.
'Looks like it was rough.'
'...Kind of.'
I didn't want to say anything more than that.
If I started to talk, I probably wouldn't be able\nto stop.
I wanted him to listen to what happened. I wanted\nto act like a little child.
He must have known how I felt as he began to pat\nme on the head.
'Well then. Let's go. The landlord's going to get\nmad at you if you're not back soon.'
'Okay. Thanks, An-chan.'
As I raised my hand to thank him, An-chan stood\nup and started to leave. He took one step and the\nstopped.
'? What's wrong?'
'...If Tobioka-sensei is going to go to that\nextent, maybe it really is our fault.'
'What do you mean...?'
'...No, I'm sorry. Forget it.'
An-chan was being unusually vague.
Thinking that strange, I went and looked at the\nmess that was behind him.
'Whew...'
Closing the door behind me, I could only sigh at\nwhat I had seen.
The winch was completely destroyed.
An-chan said that he'd try to fix it as quickly\nas possible, but at best it'd take more than a\nweek.
There was also the possibility that it couldn't\nbe fixed at all.
'I guess we can't fly anymore...'
I threw myself onto my bed. I was so exhausted I\ncould barely stand.
I opened up my cell phone as if it may have the\nanswer to my problems.
'One new message.'
'Huh?'
I hadn't even noticed that I got a message at\nsome point.
Sender: 'Kotori
Whoa!
I jumped out of bed and opened the message.
Don't worry I'll come back
It seems like she had written it in a hurry.
Even though, it was enough to completely\nreenergize me.
I quickly wrote back a reply.
Okay. I'll be waiting.
A short message is best. Only say what I have to\nsay.
I closed my phone and got up again.
'Ah.'
'Hm? Ageha!'
As soon as I entered the secret base I noticed\nAgeha was also there.
'What are you doing here?'
Hadn't she just gone home?
'What about you?'
'...I was just wondering if there was anything I\ncould do.'
'Same here.'
'...They really wanted to completely ruin this\nplace.'
'Seems so.'
I suggested to Ageha what I had come up with on\nmy way here.
'Remember that rubber cord that Yoru found a\nwhile ago? I wonder if we can use that.'
Ageha smiled smugly.
'I was thinking the same exact thing.'
'Hmm... Well, do you really think this will get\nthe glider to fly?'
'I don't know...'
It was something that looked like a bunch of\nrubber bands put together to make a rope.
It was quite long and right in the middle it had\na metal ring attached.
It looked as if it was designed to attach to the\nglider's hook.
Yoru had found it in this warehouse. Through a\nlittle research, Ageha found out that it was used\nfor launching gliders.
Using the recoil from rubber should make it\npossible to fly.
'...I just can't see this working.'
'...You're right.'
Someone entered the dock.
'Ageha. Aoi.'
'...What are you two doing?'
'...That's what we should be asking you.'
It seems Asa and Yoru were thinking the same\nthing we were.
We came here thinking there might be something we\ncan do.
'Hehehe... We've just got to keep our heads up.'
'We don't really have much in the way of time or\noptions.'
'Well, you could say the Soaring Club is made of\neasy to understand people or...'
'We're all just of one mind!'
I decided it was a good time to pull out my cell\nphone and show it to everybody.
'I got a message from Kotori earlier.'
'No way.'
'Really?'
'What did she say?'
Don't worry I'll come back
Everyone stared at the short message.
It was almost as if they expected some other\nmeaning to be hidden amongst those five words.
'...Well then, if we're not ready to take off by\nthe time she gets back, we're sure going to hear\nit.'
'If we just sit around sucking our thumbs, she'll\nbe livid, no doubt about it.'
As I said this, everyone began snickering as they\nremembered the time Kotori flipped out on me.
'Okay, first let's look up on this a bit.'
Ageha gathered a bit of information on the\ninternet.
We all began to stare at what she had found.
'Rubber cord towing...'
Taking off via a winch is winch towing. Using a\nrubber cord is rubber cord towing.
'Also known as a 'slingshot takeoff'...?'
The long rubber cord is attached to the glider,\nthe ends are pulled and then off it flies. Just\nlike a sling shot.
In this slingshot, though, you don't want the\nshots to just go all over the place.
'Wow, it seems kind of primitive.'
'Could that really get the glider to fly?'
'Hmm... Well, let's watch this video.'
Ageha clicked to open up the video.
It was of a rubber cord towing of a glider by a\nriver bed.
To us it was quite the spectacle.
First the ring on the rubber cord is attached to\nthe hook that we used for the winch.
Then glider stays in place while the cord is\npulled on, with a lot of manpower.
Sort of like a huge tug of war.
When the cord is pulled just enough, the pilot\nreleases the break and then...
'Wow... That's low.'
Yoru began growling at the video.
'It flew... but only a little.'
The glider flew up about maybe one or two meters\nhigh.
It didn't even go ten meters.
Ageha read the instructions.
'Hmm, hmm... This seems to be used to fly a\npretty light glider.'
'Ours is a two-seater... This'd be hard to do.'
The weight of the two people wouldn't help\neither.
'I doubt we could even get it up in the air...'
'There wouldn't be enough acceleration...'
Even if it did, getting it high enough to get to\nthe clouds would be another problem.
At that acceleration, the glider would stall\nbefore getting onto a vertical draft.
'There's quite a difference in power between a\nwinch and people.'
'To get a two-seater glider high enough, we'd\nneed a lot of manpower and a long enough rubber\ncord.'
We'd need enough people to pull it. It might\ntheoretically be possible, but realistically it's\nclose to impossible.
And there's no way we'd get a long enough cord in\ntime.
'...Yeah, I don't think this will work.'
'Hmm... I dunno. There might still be a way.'
Ageha began searching on the internet again.
'Okay, you handle this. I'm going to go look for\nthe glider.'
'Look?'
'Before we take the glider back we have to know\nwhere it is, right?'
'What!? No!'
I told Ma-bou my plan after he took me to the\nschool. He wasn't taking the idea well.
'Please! You gotta do something!'
'What do you mean, 'something'? It's not going to\nbe pretty if we get caught this time.'
'I won't say that you told me. Please!'
'You say that and I still got in trouble this\nlast time...'
I was only asking that he helped me find where\nthe glider was being stored. That's all.
Since he's part of student council, he can get\nplaces most students can't.
'You guys have no idea what you're going to do if\nyou get caught this time, do you?'
'Nope.'
'Man, you gotta stop this. You guys always go too\nfar.'
'...It's just a question of flying or not, right?\nWhy are you going through all this trouble?'
'Well, you see...'
I stopped mid-sentence.
'Are you telling me you don't even know why\nyou're doing this?'
'No! I just hadn't sat down and put all my\nthoughts together, that's all.'
I could try to do it, but there was just no way\nto really put it into words.
'I don't know the best way to say it but... well,\nit feels like if I don't do it I'd be betraying\nmyself.'
'...I really worked so hard on this.'
How could I possibly betray my own hard work?
Remembering the time Kotori and I stared straight\nup at the sky, that is exactly what I didn't want\nto betray.
He tilted his head to the side with a confused\nexpression on his face.
Suddenly, he sighed.
'...You sure are great.'
'It's always been this way... You and Ageha are\nso different from me.'
'Really...?'
Now it was my turn to be confused.
'I've been admiring you two for almost all of my\nlife.'
'Really...'
Ma-bou gave me a frustrated look as I nodded only\nhalf understanding what he was saying.
'Okay, okay. I'll help you.'
'Really???'
'We've been friends too long. I think your crazy\nis rubbing off on me.'
'But do not let Akari find out about this. If she\nfinds out...'
'What are you two talking about?'
'Whoaa!!?'
'Why... Why are you here?'
'? This is school, isn't it?'
That's true.
'But it's summer vacation...'
'I have to submit the estimate repair cost for\nthe club house today.'
She spoke in a jaded tone. Akari really is a hard\nworker.
'...That's just how it is. Sorry I couldn't be\nany help.'
'What!?'
'(What happened to the way you were acting just a\nfew minutes ago?!)'
'(You gotta understand! My relationship with\nAkari means a whole lot more to me than you\nguys.)'
Akari looked at the two of us whispering with an\nemotionless look on her face.
'I actually have something to talk to you about,\nAoi. But it seems like you're busy at the\nmoment.'
'No, no. Don't worry. We're done talking. Isn't\nthat right, Aoi?'
'No, we're not! But anyway, what is it you want\nto talk about?'
Akari wanting to talk to me wasn't exactly a\ncommon thing.
'I heard about Kotori.'
'It's unfortunate, but the student council cannot\nprotect you. I'm sorry that we cannot be any\nhelp.'
'I understand. That's how it was from the start,\nanyway.'
'I should be the one apologizing. Sorry about all\nthe trouble we caused you.'
Akari had approved the Soaring Club which had\nmade her take on responsibility for it.
'I don't care about that. I did it because I\nbelieved in you.'
'However, it is unfortunate that this happened.'
'...I also wanted to see you all fly that\nglider.'
Akari was looking out of the window as she spoke\nto me.
'What has Amane been after all of these years...'
'I wanted to see the results of all of that with\nmy own eyes.'
'Akari...'
'That's all I have to talk to you about.'
Akari's business persona had returned. Once she\nwas finished, she turned around and walked don\nthe hallway.
After a few steps she stopped.
She stood still with her back to us.
'Akari...?'
She suddenly turned around and walked towards us.
'Yesterday I saw Tobioka-sensei and some other\nteachers bringing something big to school.'
'Huh?'
'I don't know what it was and I don't really care\nbut, it seems like they put it in the gym\nstoreroom out on the sports field.'
'The door to that is always kept tightly locked.'
'Ah, thanks... but why are you...'
'No reason. Can't we chat a little?'
Saying that in an irritated tone, she turned\naround again.
'Goodbye.'
This time she actually left.
'Th...Thank you!'
I stared at the ground, completely dumbfounded.
'...Why did she tell me that?'
'Hmm. Well, what Tobioka did was pretty\ndespicable. It's both infuriating and scary.'
The gym store room...
'Alright. Let's go, partner.'
'Who are you calling 'partner'?'
I headed off to the sports field almost pulling\nMa-bou behind me.
As expected, the storeroom was locked.
I did a quick inspection of the warehouse and\ntook my leave.
'Well, at least we learned where it's being\nkept.'
Now we can get it back when we have to.
Of course, that is a huge risk to take.
I rushed back to the secret base, deep in\nthought.
As I was walking up a slight hill, I glanced at\nthe sky over the lake.
I began to run.
'Wow, that's beautiful. It's just like a\nsunrise.'
'Hey, Ageha. Is that...'
'Yeah. Probably... At least I think so.'
'Pant, pant, pant...!'
I ran down the hill towards the runway.
I placed my hands on my knees and tried to catch\nmy breath.
My cell phone had been ringing for some time now.
I answered it without checking to see who was\ncalling.
'Pant, pant, Hello?'
'Ah, Aoi! Look at the sky!!'
'...I can see it.'
Standing in the middle of the runway, I had a\nclear view of the sky.
The eastern sky was a bluish purple.
To the west, the sky was the same orange that it\nalways was at sunset.
This is what we had been waiting for all this\ntime.
The sky we had been yearning for. Praying for.
Staring at the beautiful gradient of the bluish\npurple to the deep vermillion, my body began to\ntremble.
I was suddenly overjoyed, excited and impatient.\nEach second a new feeling welled up inside of me.
'Hey, that's... It has to be.'
'...Yeah, it's the sign.'
'The Morning Glory is coming.'
